title: 107_hr2558
content: The Act titled "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" allows for voluntary early retirement incentive plans in governmental and higher education sectors. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to allow voluntary retirement incentive plans in educational institutions, providing supplemental benefits based on age at retirement. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows employees to receive retirement or severance benefits within 365 days, with specific conditions for eligibility and timing of retirement elections. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 provides employees with the opportunity to receive retirement benefits if they were not previously afforded such benefits in their employment. The amendment applies to determining violations of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act for voluntary early retirement plans in educational institutions after January 1, 1996. SEC. 3. Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to include provisions for voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies and retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare benefits. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 is amended to include provisions for voluntary early retirement incentive plans and retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare benefits for retired participants. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 was amended to include provisions for voluntary early retirement incentive plans, with no inference drawn on whether such plans constitute a defined benefit plan.
